### blockEndsInUnreachable() {#a4683663d1041570f374ad7ac4ea119eb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;HotColdSplitting.cpp&#125;::blockEndsInUnreachable (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &amp; BB)</>}>
A no successor, non-return block probably ends in unreachable and is cold.

Also consider a block that ends in an indirect branch to be a return block, since many targets use plain indirect branches to return.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/hotcoldsplitting-cpp/#l00102">102</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/hotcoldsplitting-cpp">HotColdSplitting.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### markFunctionCold() {#a765c9255c8dcd77f3a29a02ffcb3ea8f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;HotColdSplitting.cpp&#125;::markFunctionCold (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F, bool UpdateEntryCount=false)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Mark <code>F</code> cold.

Based on this assumption, also optimize it for minimum size. If <code>UpdateEntryCount</code> is true (set when this is a new split function and module has profile data), set entry count to 0 to ensure treated as cold. Return true if the function is changed.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/hotcoldsplitting-cpp/#l00195">195</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/hotcoldsplitting-cpp">HotColdSplitting.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
